title: China sends 30 warplanes near Taiwan as US congressional delegation visits
description: A US delegation led by Sen. Tammy Duckworth, an Illinois Democrat, arrived in Taipei on Monday in a previously unannounced visit, Taiwan's foreign ministry said.

title: German Chancellor accused of comparing climate activists to Nazis
description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz was accused Monday of comparing climate activists to Nazis, in allegations that his spokesperson said were "completely absurd."

title: Trudeau announces bill that would place freeze on handgun ownership across Canada
description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on Monday announced the introduction of a bill that would place a national freeze on handgun ownership across Canada.

title: 'It's a catastrophe': Russians strike Lysychansk with maximum intensity
description: Russian strikes in Lysychansk have increased with maximum ferocity.  CNN's Nick Paton Walsh reports from the eastern Ukrainian city, where residents must decide between staying in their homes or fleeing for their lives.

title: See baby sloth reunite with mom after rescue team found it crying
description: After a baby sloth fell from a tall tree, staff members at the Jaguar Rescue Center in Costa Rica worked to make sure it was healthy before reuniting it with its mom.

title: French journalist shot and killed in Ukraine
description: A French journalist has been shot and killed in Ukraine, according to French President Emmanuel Macron.

title: Egypt uncovers large trove of ancient bronze statues and sarcophagi in Saqqara
description: A large trove of ancient bronze statues and well-preserved sarcophagi discovered in Egypt's Saqqara were revealed to the public on Monday, the Egyptian Ministry of Tourism and Antiquities said in a statement.

title: Lionel Messi reveals his behind-the-scenes Covid-19 struggle
description: Paris Saint-Germain and Argentina superstar Lionel Messi has revealed the difficulties he faced after contracting Covid-19. The 34-year-old contracted the virus in early January, as reported by CNN.

title: Woman describes atrocities Russian soldiers conducted on her husband
description: In southern Ukraine, Russian forces continue to shell towns and villages in the Mykolaiv region. CNN's Sara Sidner met with residents, including one woman who says her husband was killed by Russian soldiers.

title: Israelis lament 'racism problem' as Jerusalem march turns ugly
description: A march on Sunday to commemorate the establishment of Israeli control over East Jerusalem in 1967 was marred by incidents of violence and hate that left some Israelis disturbed.

title: Video captures dramatic rescue of 4-year-old
description: Surveillance video captured the dramatic rescue of a 4-year-old boy drowning in a pool at an apartment complex in Lawrence, Kansas.

title: Master P reveals his daughter Tytyana Miller, 29, has died
description: Master P and his family are mourning the loss of his daughter Tytyana Miller.

title: Drone footage shows devastating aftermath of deadly Brazil floods
description: More than 80 people died and dozens are still missing after heavy rains triggered floods and landslides in Brazil's northeastern state of Pernambuco.

title: Tensions boil over as Jewish nationalists march through Palestinian district of Jerusalem's Old City
description: 'Jerusalem Day' sparks clashes between Israeli police and Palestinians as Jewish nationalists march through ​Old City. CNN's Atika Shubert reports.

title: Why this 1000-horse power electric vehicle should have Tesla scared
description: Lucid Motors won Motor Trend's Car of the Year award with its first ever vehicle, the Lucid Air. CNN's Peter Valdes-Dapena explains why this 1000-horse power electric vehicle should have Tesla scared.

title: CNN anchor presses NRA board member after shooting: You need to look into your souls
description: CNN's Jim Acosta presses Judge Phillip Journey, an NRA board member, on gun laws and the organization's priorities following the school shooting in Uvalde, Texas.

title: Rafael Nadal set to meet archrival Novak Djokovic in the French Open quarterfinals
description: During Rafael Nadal's long illustrious career, he has played 112 matches at Roland Garros and won 109 of them.

title: 2 people were killed and at least 19 injured when vehicles crashed into pedestrians in Lincoln, Nebraska
description: Two people are dead and at least 19 others injured after a two-car crash struck multiple pedestrians in Lincoln, Nebraska, according to authorities.

title: China's trade and security meeting in Fiji ends in disagreement
How Olympian Alexi Pappas deals with the 'metaphorical scratch on your brain'
description: Olympic distance runner Alexi Pappas describes herself as an "extremely motivated person," and it would be difficult to disagree.

title: Indian rapper turned politician Sidhu Moose Wala shot dead
description: Police are searching for the killers of prominent Indian rapper turned politician Sidhu Moose Wala, who was shot by unidentified assailants while driving near his home in the Mansa district of India's Punjab state on Sunday.

title: Chaos erupts as angry fans storm the pitch following the Saint-Étienne's relegation to Ligue 2
description: Sunday's relegation playoff between Saint-Étienne's and AJ Auxerre was marred by violence, just one day after crowd and police confrontations affected the Champions League Final.

title: 'We failed these children': Agony and outrage in Texas city devastated by school shooting
9-year-old describes escaping out a window during Uvalde school shooting
description:
• 'We failed these children': Agony and outrage in Texas 
• Analysis: Biden mourns with families but honoring pleas to 'do something' will be harder
• Video: Resident shouts at Biden and Abbott

title: Monkeypox - how does it spread and what are the symptoms?
description: The Monkeypox virus is a less-severe cousin of the Smallpox virus. Dr Sanjay Gupta says it has been spreading among younger people as they are less likely to have been inoculated against Smallpox, which was eradicated in 1977.

title: Nepal search and rescue teams recover bodies of 14 people on board downed flight
description: A plane operated by Nepal's Tara Air carrying 22 people went missing at 9:55 a.m. local time on Sunday, an airline spokesperson confirmed to CNN.

title: Vietnam's new glass bridge sets Guinness World Record
description: A glass-bottomed walkway in Vietnam, which opened to much public fanfare in April, has been declared the world's longest bridge of its kind by Guinness World Records.

title: 'Irreplaceable' $2 million tabernacle stolen from Catholic church in Brooklyn, police say
description: A tabernacle valued at $2 million was stolen from a Catholic church in Brooklyn last week and statues of angels flanking the altar were decapitated in the process, police said.

title: Hurricane Agatha rapidly intensifies in the eastern Pacific as it barrels toward Mexico
description: Hurricane Agatha has rapidly intensified in the eastern Pacific Ocean and was nearing major hurricane status as it approached the southern Mexican coast Sunday night.

title: Nancy Pelosi's husband charged with DUI after Porsche crash in Napa
description: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's husband was arrested for driving under the influence, according to the Napa County Criminal Justice Network's public booking report.

title: Violence erupts around Jerusalem during controversial flag march
description: Thousands of Israelis marched in a controversial flag-waving procession through east Jerusalem on Sunday, after Palestinian factions warned the event could ignite a new round of tensions.

title: Colombia's presidential vote headed for a runoff
description: Colombia's presidential election appears destined for a runoff, after preliminary results on Sunday showed no candidate had garnered over 50% of the votes.

title: Naomi Osaka 'petrified' after seeing people flee Brooklyn's Barclays Center
description: No shots were fired at the Barclays Center during a disturbance that sent people, including tennis star Naomi Osaka, running for their lives early Sunday, said the New York City Police Department.

title: Their mom was killed, then their dad died of a heart attack. Now people are donating millions for their family
description: • These are the 21 victims

title: Ukrainian mother's video diary shows her family's life during wartime
description: Ukrainian mother Olena Gnes has been keeping a video diary of what her family's experience has been throughout the war. CNN's Anderson Cooper reports on her rare perspective.

title: The patients at this New Zealand rehab center aren't people -- they're penguins
description: Sassy, hardy, and vicious: that's how yellow-eyed penguins are fondly described by the people who spend their days working with them.

title: The Utah mom climbing the world's highest mountains
description: In 1986, American businessman Richard Bass landed in the record books by becoming the first person to climb the "seven summits," the highest peaks from each continent. On that list are some of the most iconic mountains in the world: Denali in Alaska, Kilimanjaro in Tanzania and of course Mount Everest.

title: Inside New Zealand's penguin rescue and rehab center
description: The yellow-eyed penguin -- known as hoiho which means "noise shouter" in Māori -- is the largest of the penguin species that live on New Zealand's mainland. But in recent decades, hoiho numbers have plummeted. Now, conservationists are racing to save these rare birds from extinction.

title: Video shows people running during Barclays Center disturbance
description: No shots were fired at the Barclays Center during a disturbance that sent people running for their lives early Sunday, said the New York City Police Department. CNN's Nadia Romero reports.

title: Several young gunshot victims hospitalized following shooting in Chattanooga, Tennessee
description: Several gunshot victims were transported to a hospital Saturday night following a shooting in downtown Chattanooga, Tennessee, police said in a news release.

title: Uvalde resident explains why he shouts at Biden and Abbott
description: Uvalde resident Ben Gonzales explains to CNN's Jim Acosta why he shouted at President Joe Biden and Texas Governor Greg Abbott during their visit to the city.
